meanings.definition: Superlative form of 'kempt', meaning well-groomed or neatly maintained.
meanings.sent1: She always looks the kempiest in our group, with her hair neatly styled and clothes perfectly ironed.
meanings.sent2: The groomer made sure the poodle looked the kempiest among all the dogs at the show.
meanings.sent3: Even after playing in the mud, he managed to look the kempiest at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her kempiest appearance shone like a polished gem among the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The kempiest garden on the block was meticulously tended to every day.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'kempy', meaning rough or coarse in texture.
meanings.sent1: Out of all the fabrics, the wool sweater felt the kempiest against my skin.
meanings.sent2: The kempiest rope in the shed was too rough to use for delicate tasks.
meanings.sent3: The kempiest sandpaper available was perfect for smoothing out the rough edges.
meanings.sent4: The kempiest surface of the rock felt like sandpaper under my fingertips.
meanings.sent5: The kempiest towel in the set was too scratchy to use comfortably.
